title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to block the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while legal proceedings are ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has announced in its latest Windows 11 Insider Preview that it will remove a bypass script previously allowing users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection and logging in. This move enforces the requirement for an internet-connected account for all Windows 11 devices.
summary: Microsoft will enforce an internet-connected account setup for all Windows 11 devices by removing a bypass script that allowed offline setup. This change was announced in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will continue until Monday, March 31st. The sale features dozens of deals accessible to all customers, not just Amazon Prime members. There is a comprehensive roundup of over 100 deals on popular gear, including some more affordable options.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is happening now through March 31st, offering a wide range of deals to all customers, not just Prime members. The sale includes a roundup of over 100 deals on various popular products, with options for more budget-friendly choices available.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. The transaction values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion in debt. This acquisition comes a few years after Musk purchased Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion of debt. This follows Musk's previous purchase of Twitter for $44 billion a few years ago.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that won't boot. This feature, first announced last year, is designed to prevent incidents similar to the previous Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool allows IT professionals to remotely fix devices that fail to boot, aiming to prevent situations like the past Crowdstrike issue.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year. This update comes after Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021, which initially set a 2025 deadline for account migration. The extension was announced in an email to Fitbit users.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts until next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. Initially, users were required to migrate by 2025. The extension was communicated to Fitbit users via email.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time

summary: The Metals Company (TMC), focused on starting deep-sea mining, sought better relations with the Trump administration after facing challenges in global discussions. In 2021, Nauru, an island country, backed TMC's initiative, pushing forward the creation of mining rules.

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'

summary: Researchers have developed a treatment that reverses cell damage caused by anthrax in mice, using a growth factor cocktail. This breakthrough suggests the possibility of adapting the treatment for human use.

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have created an advanced AI model that improves predictions on chemotherapy responses in muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This model uniquely combines whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analysis, surpassing the accuracy of older models that relied on just one type of data.
summary: Researchers have developed a new AI model that enhances the prediction of chemotherapy outcomes in patients with muscle-invasive bladder cancer. This innovative model integrates whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analysis, achieving higher accuracy than previous models based on a single data type.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a direct link between dopamine levels in the brain and cognitive flexibility, observing through PET imaging that increased dopamine production is associated with more efficient completion of challenging tasks. This finding could lead to improved treatment options for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Researchers have found a direct connection between brain dopamine levels and cognitive flexibility, showing that higher dopamine production leads to better performance on difficult tasks. This discovery, made using PET imaging, could enhance treatments for neurological and psychiatric conditions.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This breakthrough could enhance understanding of how latent infections in the nervous system are controlled.
summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can detect and control the dormant stage of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This discovery may improve knowledge of how latent infections in the nervous system are managed.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has examined why certain plants flourish in specific regions but not others. It found that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers play significant roles in shaping plant distributions and influencing global plant diversity, tracing how these patterns have evolved over millions of years.
summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species revealed that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers significantly impact where plants thrive, shaping the distribution and diversity of global plant life over millions of years.
